## **1\. Prerequisites (System Requirements)**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: List all the software and tools required to run this project locally based on the Architecture document. Specify the exact or minimum versions required. \--\>

Please ensure your local machine has the following software installed before proceeding:

| Software / Tool | Minimum Version | Purpose |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| **\[e.g., Node.js\]** | \[e.g., v20.x LTS\] | Runtime environment for frontend and backend. |
| **\[e.g., npm / pnpm\]** | \[e.g., pnpm v9.x\] | Package manager. DO NOT use yarn or npm to avoid lockfile conflicts. |
| **\[e.g., Docker\]** | \[e.g., Latest\] | To run local instances of the database and Redis cache. |
| **\[e.g., PostgreSQL\]** | \[e.g., v15+\] | (Optional) If not using Docker for the database. |

## **2\. Environment Variables (.env)**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: List all required environment variables for the local development environment.

CRITICAL RULE: NEVER put real production secrets, API keys, or actual passwords in this document. Use dummy values only. \--\>

Duplicate the .env.example file and rename it to .env. Fill in the values based on the table below:

| Variable Name | Dummy/Local Value | Description |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| PORT | 3000 | The port the application will run on. |
| NODE\_ENV | development | Defines the environment. |
| DATABASE\_URL | postgresql://user:pass@localhost:5432/mydb | Local connection string for the database. |
| JWT\_SECRET | local\_super\_secret\_key\_123 | Secret key for signing JSON Web Tokens locally. |
| \[API\_KEY\_NAME\] | sk\_test\_12345 | \[Description of the external API key\] |

## **3\. Installation & Setup Steps**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Provide step-by-step CLI commands to clone, install, and prepare the project. Use code blocks for all commands. \--\>

### **Step 3.1: Repository Setup**

\# 1\. Clone the repository  
git clone \[repository-url\]  
cd \[project-folder\]

\# 2\. Install dependencies  
\[e.g., pnpm install\]

### **Step 3.2: Database Initialization**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Provide the specific commands to start the database (e.g., docker-compose), run migrations, and seed initial data. \--\>

\# 1\. Start the database container (if applicable)  
\[e.g., docker-compose up \-d db\]

\# 2\. Run database migrations  
\[e.g., npx prisma migrate dev\]

\# 3\. Seed the database with initial/dummy data  
\[e.g., npx prisma db seed\]

## **4\. Running the Application**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Provide the exact commands needed to start the development servers. If there are separate commands for frontend, backend, or background workers, list them clearly. \--\>

| Component | Command | Local URL / Port |
| :---- | :---- | :---- |
| **Frontend/Client** | \[e.g., pnpm run dev:frontend\] | http://localhost:3000 |
| **Backend/API** | \[e.g., pnpm run dev:backend\] | http://localhost:4000 |
| **Worker/Queue** | \[e.g., pnpm run dev:worker\] | N/A (Runs in background) |
| **DB Studio/GUI** | \[e.g., npx prisma studio\] | http://localhost:5555 |

## **5\. Common Issues & Troubleshooting**

\<\!-- AI INSTRUCTION: Anticipate 2-3 common errors a developer might face during setup (e.g., port already in use, missing env variables) and provide the solution. \--\>

* **Error:** \[e.g., Error: P1001: Can't reach database server at localhost:5432\]  
  * **Solution:** \[e.g., Ensure your Docker container is running by executing docker ps. If not, run docker-compose up \-d.\]  
* **Error:** \[e.g., Error: listen EADDRINUSE: address already in use :::3000\]  
  * **Solution:** \[e.g., Kill the process using port 3000 or change the PORT variable in your .env file.\]
